programme.title: Chelsea vs. Liverpool - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: After their 3-1 win in May, Chelsea could enjoy back-to-back league wins over Liverpool for the first time since November 2014. Liverpool are winless in their last four Premier League games at Stamford Bridge and could lose away to Chelsea two seasons running in the league for the first time since losing three on the bounce from 2004-05 to 2006-07.

programme.title: Newcastle United vs. Arsenal - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Newcastle United have won each of their last three home games against Arsenal in all competitions without conceding a single goal, while they last won four in a row at home to the Gunners in August 1969. Under Mikel Arteta, Arsenal have only lost more away games at Manchester City in all competitions than they have away to Newcastle United.

programme.title: Leeds United vs. Tottenham Hotspur - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Leeds United have lost nine of their last 11 Premier League games against Tottenham Hotspur, including each of their last four in a row – their longest ever league losing run to Spurs. Tottenham have won both of their last two league visits to Elland Road and could beat Leeds United away from home three times running in the league for the very first time.

programme.title: Newcastle United vs Nottingham Forest - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8
programme.desc: Newcastle United have won six of their last seven league meetings with Nottingham Forest, including their last three in a row since a 1-3 defeat in December 2023. The Magpies last won more in succession over the Tricky Trees in March 1937. Nottingham Forest have lost eight of their last nine league visits to Newcastle United, conceding 24 goals in this period.

programme.title: Lille vs PSG - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7
programme.desc: Lille have won just one of their last 13 home Ligue 1 games against Paris SG, a 5-1 victory on 14 April 2019, which remains Paris Saint-Germains biggest away defeat in the top-flight in the 21st century. Lille have lost their last two Ligue 1 matches and could suffer three consecutive defeats in the competition for the first time since December 2019-January 2020. Lille could also fail to score in three consecutive Ligue 1 games for the first time since September 2017.

programme.title: Espanyol vs Real Betis - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 8
programme.desc: Espanyol have won only one of their last five LaLiga home games against opponents Real Betis, after winning five of their previous seven such matches. Real Betis have won their last three LaLiga matches against Espanyol, their second-best winning streak against them in the top flight, after five consecutive victories between 1981 and 1983.

programme.title: Girona vs Valencia - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 8
programme.desc: Girona have lost just one of their last five LaLiga matches against Valencia, this after losing four of their previous five against them in the competition. After not losing any of their first four visits to Girona in all competitions, Valencia have since lost two of their last three.

programme.title: Celtic FC vs SC Braga - UEFA Europa League 2025/2026 - MD2
programme.desc: The 2025–26 UEFA Europa League is the secondary club football tournament organised by UEFA. programme.title: Brest vs Nantes - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7
programme.desc: Brest have won five of their last six matches against Nantes in all competitions, just one fewer than in their first 34 competitive clashes with FCN. Brest have won each of their last two Ligue 1 matches – as many as across their previous ten – but have not not won three in a row in the competition since January 2025.

programme.title: Strasbourg vs Angers SCO - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7
programme.desc: Angers have won their last two matches against Strasbourg in all competitions and could win three in a row for the very first time in 67 meetings between the two sides. Strasbourg have lost two of their last four Ligue 1 matches, as many defeats as they suffered across their previous 16 games in the competition.

programme.title: Everton vs Crystal Palace - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8
programme.desc: Everton have lost just one of their last 21 Premier League meetings with Crystal Palace, a 1-3 defeat in December 2021. Indeed, among all sides they have faced 20+ times in the competition, their points-per-game rate of 1.81 against the Eagles is bettered only against West Brom. Crystal Palace are winless in each of their last 10 Premier League away games against Everton since a 3-2 victory in September 2014 under Neil Warnock.

programme.title: Monaco vs Nice - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7
programme.desc: Monaco will face OGC Nice for the 131st time in all competitions. Monaco have recorded 58 wins against OGC Nice, a figure they have only achieved against Lyon and Rennes. OGC Nice, in turn, have lost to Monaco 58 times in all competitions, with only defeats against Marseille being more frequent. Monaco have lost three of their last five Ligue 1 matches against Nice, as many defeats as in their previous 12 encounters with OGCN.

programme.title: Le Havre vs Rennes - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7
programme.desc: Le Havre have lost four of their last five home games against Rennes in Ligue 1, after only losing one of the first 16. Le Havre failed to score for the third time in Ligue 1 in 2025 in their last match at Metz ; only Lyon and Paris SG have failed to score in fewer matches in the competition this calendar year among ever present teams. It was also Le Havre’s second clean sheet of the year, the lowest tally amongst all teams in Ligue 1.

programme.title: Olympique Lyonnais vs Toulouse - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7
programme.desc: Olympique Lyonnais are unbeaten in their last 17 Ligue 1 matches against Toulouse FC, a longer run in the top-flight has only been recorded against Saint-Étienne. Olympique Lyonnais have conceded just three goals in Ligue 1 this season, the joint-lowest tally in the league alongside Nice, and their fewest after six matches of a top-flight campaign since 2015/16.

programme.title: Auxerre vs Lens - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7
programme.desc: Auxerre have won only one of their last 10 Ligue 1 matches against Lens but that was the most recent, a 4-0 win in April 2025. Auxerre have won just one of their last 11 home games against Lens in all competitions, after winning seven of the previous eight.

programme.title: Lille vs PSG - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7
programme.desc: Lille have won just one of their last 13 home Ligue 1 games against Paris SG, a 5-1 victory on 14 April 2019, which remains Paris Saint-Germains biggest away defeat in the top-flight in the 21st century. Lille have lost their last two Ligue 1 matches and could suffer three consecutive defeats in the competition for the first time since December 2019-January 2020. Lille could also fail to score in three consecutive Ligue 1 games for the first time since September 2017.

programme.title: Metz vs Olympique Marseille - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7
programme.desc: Metz have not won any of their last nine Ligue 1 matches against Olympique Marseille, only against Paris Saint-Germain and Lille are they currently on a longer winless run in the top-flight. Metz have not won any of their last eight matches in all competitions, their longest winless run since December 2023-February 2024.

programme.desc: Olympique Lyonnais are unbeaten in their last 17 Ligue 1 matches against Toulouse FC, a longer run in the top-flight has only been recorded against Saint-Étienne. programme.title: Le Havre vs Rennes - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7
programme.desc: Le Havre have lost four of their last five home games against Rennes in Ligue 1, after only losing one of the first 16. Le Havre failed to score for the third time in Ligue 1 in 2025 in their last match at Metz ; only Lyon and Paris SG have failed to score in fewer matches in the competition this calendar year among ever present teams. It was also Le Havre’s second clean sheet of the year, the lowest tally amongst all teams in Ligue 1.

As the 2026 Games in Japan draw near, excitement builds over what new spectacle will capture the world’s imagination.

programme.title: Chelsea vs Liverpool -English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8 - Mini Match
programme.desc: After their 3-1 win in May, Chelsea could enjoy back-to-back league wins over Liverpool for the first time since November 2014. Liverpool are winless in their last four Premier League games at Stamford Bridge and could lose away to Chelsea two seasons running in the league for the first time since losing three on the bounce from 2004-05 to 2006-07.

programme.title: Real Madrid vs Villarreal -Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 8 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Real Madrid have not lost any of their last four LaLiga games against Villarreal, winning the last two, this after failing to win any of their previous four against the Yellows in the competition. They have not won three or more in a row against them in LaLiga since 2011. Villarreal have lost 17 of their 25 LaLiga away matches against Real Madrid, their highest number of away defeats against a single opponent in the competition.

programme.title: EN EPL Match Officials Micd Up 2025/26 | E2

programme.title: Manchester United vs Sunderland - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Manchester United have lost just two of their last 30 league games against Sunderland, with this their first since a 3-0 win in April 2017. Across all competitions, Sunderland have managed to win just one of their last 31 away games against Manchester United, winning 1-0 in May 2014 thanks to Sebastian Larsson’s winner.

programme.title: Lille vs PSG - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Lille have won just one of their last 13 home Ligue 1 games against Paris SG, a 5-1 victory on 14 April 2019, which remains Paris Saint-Germains biggest away defeat in the top-flight in the 21st century. Lille have lost their last two Ligue 1 matches and could suffer three consecutive defeats in the competition for the first time since December 2019-January 2020. Lille could also fail to score in three consecutive Ligue 1 games for the first time since September 2017.

programme.title: Brentford vs Manchester City - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Since completing a Premier League double over Manchester City in 2022-23, Brentford are winless in their last four against the Citizens in the division. Manchester City have only lost one of their four Premier League visits to Brentford, going down 1-0 on the final day of the 2022-23 season.

programme.desc: Real Madrid have not lost any of their last four LaLiga games against Villarreal, winning the last two, this after failing to win any of their previous four against the Yellows in the competition. Villarreal have lost 17 of their 25 LaLiga away matches against Real Madrid, their highest number of away defeats against a single opponent in the competition.

programme.title: Chelsea vs Liverpool -English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8 - Mini Match
programme.desc: After their 3-1 win in May, Chelsea could enjoy back-to-back league wins over Liverpool for the first time since November 2014. programme.title: Film Des Finales 2025 - Championnat De France - Volleyball 2425
programme.desc: Sport, Sport, Volleyball. Plongez dans lintensite du Championnat de France de Volleyball, ou passion, rivalites et incroyable athletisme saffrontent sur le terrain entre les meilleures equipes du pays.

programme.title: Salon VIP - Magazine 2025-2026
programme.desc: Sport, Football, Sport magazine. Interviews exclusives de joueurs et temoignages de supporters passionnes : plongez dans les coulisses du football avec des points de vue dinities, des histoires inedites et des debats enflammes autour du ballon rond. Host: Claire Arnoux.

programme.title: DTM Show 2025-Red Bull Ring Part 1
programme.desc: DTM. The embodiment of Motorsport tradition. Having just turned 40, the DTM combines a unique fascination and familiarity with an unmistakable dynamic, signified by the rebranding with a new logo! Seven different manufacturers – ten different winners on six brands (Audi, BMW, Mercedes, Lamborghini, Porsche and Ferrari) through twelve races are but one testament to the unique competitive balance that makes every DTM weekend a revelation! And with the addition of Ford, the palette of different brands is only increasing!

programme.title: Paris FC vs OH Leuven - UEFA Women’s Champions League 2025/2026 - MD1
programme.desc: The 2025/2026 UEFA Womens Champions League is live and exclusive only on beIN. This is the first season under a new format, which have 18 participating teams, playing six games each against different opponents in a league phase, all in a joint group. The teams are competing for a place in the final that will be played at the Ullevaal Stadion in Oslo, Norway on May 2026. Barcelona are the current Champions.

programme.title: Al Sailiya vs Al Arabi - Qatar Stars League 2025/26 - W6
programme.desc: The Qatari League is the official football league in Qatar. The league includes 12 teams. The most famous participating clubs are Al-Sadd, the champions of the last season; Al-Rayyan and Al-Arabi, the popular teams, Al-Duhail and Al-Gharafa, serious contenders for the title every season. The Qatari league includes star names such as Firmino, Verratti, and Qatari Akram Afif, the best player in Asia.

programme.title: Cesson-Rennes vs Montpellier - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germains 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.

programme.title: The Art of lighting the Asian Games Flame
programme.desc: The Asian Games torch lighting has become a stage for innovation, blending tradition with modern spectacle. From iconic moments to dazzling surprises, none stand out more than Doha 2006 with its dramatic horse and rider. As the 2026 Games approach in Japan, anticipation grows for the next unforgettable torch lighting ceremony.
